results.headline: Making Wispy Summertime Music in Glasgow
results.summary_short: Fresh out of a psychiatric clinic, a young woman in Glasgow teams up with a lifeguard and a rich girl to form a band in “God Help the Girl.”

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of God Help The Girl

results.headline: Down to Rio With a Haunted Avenger
results.summary_short: A traumatized ex-Marine descends into the favelas of Rio de Janeiro to investigate the brutal beating of his sister.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Falcon Rising

results.headline: On the Border, a Fall From Grace
results.summary_short: In “Frontera,” directed by Michael Berry, Ed Harris plays a retired sheriff in modern-day Arizona challenged by events at a border crossing.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Frontera

results.headline: Young Love, in the Shadow of 9/11
results.summary_short: “But Always,” directed by Snow Zou, follows two friends and later lovers from childhood in Beijing to New York.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Yi Sheng Yi Shi

results.headline: When the Visitors Don’t Walk So Lightly on the Land
results.summary_short: “Gringo Trails,” a documentary by Pegi Vail, considers the impact adventure tourists have on the exotic locations they visit.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Gringo Trails

results.headline: Depression, a Persistent Demon, Stalks One Family for Generations
results.summary_short: “Rocks in My Pockets,” an animated feature, explores a family’s struggles with depression.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Rocks in My Pockets

results.headline: A Criminal With Charm
results.summary_short: Emraan Hashmi has the title role in “Raja Natwarlal,” a story about a small-time con man forced into the big time.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Raja Natwarlal

results.headline: Mythology Lessons in the Paris Catacombs
results.summary_short: In “As Above/So Below,” fictional documentarians follow a group searching the Paris catacombs for the Philosopher’s Stone.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of As Above, So Below

results.headline: A Friendship in Limbo
results.summary_short: In “Jamie Marks Is Dead,” a dead student intrudes on the life of another teenager, who accepts it, for a while.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Jamie Marks is Dead

results.display_title: L' Etrange couleur des larmes de ton corps
results.headline: Fears and Desires, a Missing Wife and Lots of Blood
results.summary_short: “The Strange Color of Your Body’s Tears” slices and dices the images and tropes of Italian giallo-style slasher films.

results.headline: Enduring War and Adults’ Cruelty
results.summary_short: “The Notebook (Le Grand Cahier),” based on a novel by Agota Kristof, is a flinty parable of brutality and resilience: World War II seen through the eyes of twin boys.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Le Grand Cahier

results.headline: Troubled Children, Baring Their Psychic Pain
results.summary_short: “The Naked Room” presents an up-close view of children grappling with emotional trauma in a psychiatric hospital in Mexico City.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Naked Room

results.headline: A Swordsman to the End
results.summary_short: Kevin Kline plays the swashbuckling actor Erroll Flynn in his waning years in “The Last of Robin Hood.”

results.headline: Come to Granny. On Second Thought, Better Not.
results.summary_short: “The Damned,” by Victor García, takes place in a rural Colombian hotel that harbors a witch.

results.headline: Two Murders, Many Plot Twists
results.summary_short: A priest holds keys to solving murders in “The Calling,” with Susan Sarandon, Topher Grace and Donald Sutherland.

results.headline: A Woman’s Journey From Vienna, and the Nazis, and Back
results.summary_short: “Shadows From My Past” explores the Holocaust with personal testimony and interviews with public figures.

results.headline: A Miracle Drug or Quackery?
results.summary_short: Eric Merola’s documentary “Second Opinion: Laetrile at Sloan-Kettering” examines a disputed drug.

results.headline: A Japanese Fable Hinges on 180 Degrees of Separation
results.summary_short: In “Patema Inverted,” a Japanese animated tale, two teenagers come together from worlds with opposite laws of gravity.

results.headline: Husband of Kidnap Victim: Take My Wife, Please
results.summary_short: In “Life of Crime,” a wife is held for ransom — but the husband was planning to leave her anyway.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Life of Crime

results.headline: A Setting Sun at the End of the Dock
results.summary_short: Patricia Clarkson stars in “Last Weekend” as an affluent woman who takes stock of her charmed life and grapples with whether to let go of a family estate on Lake Tahoe.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Last Weekend
